channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: In Graphics | How China leapfrogged the US to become the world's leading trade power
Bear necessity: Why is a Japanese zoo making staff dress up like pandas?
Trump must be the closer, says Lutnick. Is that how US trade deals are sealed?
How China's stakes in Venezuelan oil complicate Trump's plan
Why are Iranian women burning Khamenei’s photo to light cigarettes?
Why EAM Jaishankar travelled for 7 hrs via road in the US to meet UN chief
Head-on | Could Usha Vance, a practising Hindu, be next US First Lady?
item.description: Whether JD Vance and Usha occupy the White House, or a Democrat wins the next presidential election, US policy on India will continue to reflect its hegemonistic instinct

item.title: Iran under siege: How internal unrest and external pressure have pushed Khamenei regime to the brink
item.description: The widening divide between Iranian society and the regime is increasingly evident through repeated waves of protest

item.title: Trump’s dystopian order leaves Europe angry and exposed — but India and China may have the last laugh
item.description: Donald Trump’s ‘madness’ threatens to push the world into a crisis rarely seen since World War II. But it does offer new openings for emerging powers long strangled by Western institutional lopsidedness, monopoly and hypocrisy

item.title: Maduro’s abduction exposes Western hypocrisy, mockery of international law
item.description: For India and the rest of the Global South, the outright abduction of a head of state is not troubling merely because of US action, but because it lays bare the complete helplessness of the rest of the world

item.title: Disinformation, deepfakes, and Dhaka: Inside dangerous anti-India narrative in Bangladesh
item.description: For the region, Bangladesh serves as a reminder – a bleak one – that in an age of weaponised information, truth is often the first casualty

item.title: The Donroe doctrine: How Trump’s Venezuela strike redefines US policy
item.description: Such actions replace a rules-based international order with one governed by power, increasing global mistrust and the long-term potential for conflict
